page.title: 03SIMONSIDE AGED ACCOMMODATION
page.content: Scattered throughout the area the council have bungalows built for the elderly tenants in the area. These bungalows are situated in the streets containing the other houses. Each group of bungalows is watched over by a warden living in the area and there is an intercom system linking the old person with the warden and also a flashing light outside the bungalow indicating help is required. The council also have a sheltered accomodation in the area where the residents have their independence but at the same time help is always on hand. There is also a private sheltered accomodation in the area. This was opened in 1981 and caters for single people and couples. The single flats are bed-sitters with a kitchen and bathroom, while the flats for couples have seperate sitting rooms.
